elements.name: app
elements.desc: contains one entry in a critical apparatus, with an optional lemma and usually one or more readings or notes on the relevant passage.

elements.name: abstract
elements.desc: contains a summary or formal abstract prefixed to an existing source document by the encoder.

elements.name: additional
elements.desc: groups additional information, combining bibliographic information about a manuscript or other object, or surrogate copies of it, with curatorial or administrative information.

elements.name: address
elements.group: model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_addressLike model_publicationStmtPart_detail
elements.desc: contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.

elements.name: adminInfo
elements.desc: contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript or other object, and also about the record description itself.

elements.name: altGrp
elements.desc: groups a collection of alt elements and possibly pointers.

elements.name: altIdentifier
elements.content: ((placeName? bloc? country? region? settlement? district? geogName?)? institution? repository? collection? idno note_g?)
elements.desc: contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript or other object, such as a former catalogue number.

elements.name: analytic
elements.desc: contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.

elements.name: annotation
elements.desc: represents an annotation following the Web Annotation Data Model.

elements.name: annotationBlock
elements.desc: groups together various annotations, e.g. for parallel interpretations of a spoken segment.

elements.name: appInfo
elements.desc: records information about an application which has edited the TEI file.

elements.name: application
elements.desc: provides information about an application which has acted upon the document.

elements.name: argument
elements.desc: contains a formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.

elements.name: availability
elements.desc: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, any licence applying to it, etc.

elements.name: back
elements.desc: contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.

elements.name: biblFull
elements.content: (((titleStmt editionStmt? extent? publicationStmt seriesStmt* notesStmt?) sourceDesc*)|(fileDesc profileDesc))
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_entryPart_top model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.

elements.name: biblStruct
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_entryPart_top model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic sub-elements appear and in a specified order.

elements.name: binding
elements.desc: contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: bindingDesc
elements.desc: describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript or other object, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript.

elements.name: body
elements.desc: contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.

elements.name: broadcast
elements.desc: describes a broadcast used as the source of a spoken text.

elements.name: calendar
elements.desc: describes a calendar or dating system used in a dating formula in the text.

elements.name: calendarDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the calendar system used in any dating expression found in the text.

elements.name: castGroup
elements.desc: groups one or more individual castItem elements within a cast list.

elements.name: castList
elements.desc: contains a single cast list or dramatis personae.

elements.name: category
elements.desc: contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.

elements.name: cit
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_attributable model_msItemPart model_quoteLike model_entryPart_top
elements.desc: contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example.

elements.name: citeStructure
elements.desc: declares a structure and method for citing the current document.

elements.name: classDecl
elements.desc: contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.

elements.name: climate
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: contains information about the physical climate of a place.

elements.name: correction
elements.desc: states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.

elements.name: correspAction
elements.desc: contains a structured description of the place, the name of a person/organization and the date related to the sending/receiving of a message or any other action related to the correspondence.

elements.name: correspContext
elements.desc: provides references to preceding or following correspondence related to this piece of correspondence.

elements.name: correspDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the actions related to one act of correspondence.

elements.name: custodialHist
elements.desc: contains a description of a manuscript or other object's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events.

elements.name: cRefPattern
elements.desc: specifies an expression and replacement pattern for transforming a canonical reference into a URI.

elements.name: decoDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript or other object, either as in paragraphs, or as one or more decoNote elements.

elements.name: dimensions
elements.desc: contains a dimensional specification.

elements.name: div
elements.desc: contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div1
elements.desc: contains a first-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div2
elements.desc: contains a second-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div3
elements.desc: contains a third-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div4
elements.desc: contains a fourth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div5
elements.desc: contains a fifth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div6
elements.desc: contains a sixth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

elements.name: div7
elements.desc: contains the smallest possible subdivision of the front, body or back of a text, larger than a paragraph.

elements.name: divGen
elements.desc: indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.

elements.name: docTitle
elements.desc: contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.

elements.name: editionStmt
elements.desc: groups information relating to one edition of a text.

elements.name: editorialDecl
elements.desc: provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.

elements.name: encodingDesc
elements.desc: documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.

elements.name: epigraph
elements.desc: contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start or end of a section or on a title page.

elements.name: epilogue
elements.desc: contains the epilogue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.

elements.name: equipment
elements.desc: provides technical details of the equipment and media used for an audio or video recording used as the source for a spoken text.

elements.name: event
elements.desc: contains data relating to any kind of significant event associated with a person, place, or organization.

elements.name: figure
elements.desc: groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration, formula, or figure.

elements.name: fileDesc
elements.content: ((titleStmt editionStmt? extent? publicationStmt seriesStmt* notesStmt?) sourceDesc+)
elements.desc: contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.

elements.name: floatingText
elements.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, which interrupts the text containing it at any point and after which the surrounding text resumes.

elements.name: front
elements.desc: contains any prefatory matter (headers, abstracts, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.

elements.name: graphic
elements.desc: indicates the location of a graphic or illustration, either forming part of a text, or providing an image of it.

elements.name: handDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of all the different hands used in a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: handNotes
elements.desc: contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts.

elements.name: history
elements.desc: groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: hyphenation
elements.desc: summarizes the way in which hyphenation in a source text has been treated in an encoded version of it.

elements.name: incident
elements.desc: marks any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

elements.name: interpGrp
elements.desc: collects together a set of related interpretations which share responsibility or type.

elements.name: interpretation
elements.desc: describes the scope of any analytic or interpretive information added to the text in addition to the transcription.

elements.name: imprint
elements.desc: groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

elements.name: join
elements.desc: identifies a possibly fragmented segment of text, by pointing at the possibly discontiguous elements which compose it.

elements.name: joinGrp
elements.desc: groups a collection of join elements and possibly pointers.

elements.name: keywords
elements.desc: contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.

elements.name: kinesic
elements.desc: marks any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.

elements.name: langKnowledge
elements.desc: summarizes the state of a person's linguistic knowledge, either as prose or by a list of langKnown elements.

elements.name: langUsage
elements.desc: describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects, etc. represented within a text.

elements.name: layoutDesc
elements.desc: collects the set of layout descriptions applicable to a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: lg
elements.desc: contains one or more verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.

elements.name: linkGrp
elements.desc: defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.

elements.name: list
elements.desc: contains any sequence of items organized as a list.

elements.name: listAnnotation
elements.desc: contains a list of annotations, typically encoded as annotation, annotationBlock, or note, possibly organized with nested listAnnotation elements.

elements.name: listApp
elements.desc: contains a list of apparatus entries.

elements.name: listBibl
elements.group: model_frontPart model_common model_inter model_entryPart_top model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.

elements.name: listChange
elements.desc: groups a number of change descriptions associated with either the creation of a source text or the revision of an encoded text.

elements.name: listEvent
elements.group: model_standOffPart model_common model_inter model_listLike model_personPart model_orgPart model_eventLike
elements.desc: contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable event.

elements.name: listNym
elements.desc: contains a list of nyms, that is, standardized names for any thing.

elements.name: listObject
elements.desc: contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable physical object.

elements.name: listOrg
elements.desc: contains a list of elements, each of which provides information about an identifiable organization.

elements.name: listPerson
elements.desc: contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source.

elements.name: listPlace
elements.desc: contains a list of places, optionally followed by a list of relationships (other than containment) defined amongst them.

elements.name: listPrefixDef
elements.desc: contains a list of definitions of prefixing schemes used in teidata.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using each scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

elements.name: listRelation
elements.desc: provides information about relationships identified amongst people, places, and organizations, either informally as prose or as formally expressed relation links.

elements.name: listWit
elements.desc: lists definitions for all the witnesses referred to by a critical apparatus, optionally grouped hierarchically.

elements.name: location
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: defines the location of a place as a set of geographical coordinates, in terms of other named geo-political entities, or as an address.

elements.name: locusGrp
elements.desc: groups a number of locations which together form a distinct but discontinuous item within a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: media
elements.desc: indicates the location of any form of external media such as an audio or video clip etc.

elements.name: metDecl
elements.desc: documents the notation employed to represent a metrical pattern when this is specified as the value of a met, real, or rhyme attribute on any structural element of a metrical text (e.g. lg, l, or seg).

elements.name: monogr
elements.desc: contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).

elements.name: msContents
elements.desc: describes the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items.

elements.name: msDesc
elements.group: model_common model_inter model_entryPart_top model_personPart model_msItemPart model_standOffPart model_biblLike
elements.desc: contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript or other text-bearing object such as early printed books.

elements.name: msFrag
elements.desc: contains information about a fragment described in relation to a prior context, typically as a description of a virtual reconstruction of a manuscript or other object whose fragments were catalogued separately

elements.name: msIdentifier
elements.content: (((placeName? bloc? country? region? settlement? district? geogName?)? institution? repository? collection* idno*) (msName|objectName|altIdentifier)*)
elements.desc: contains the information required to identify the manuscript or similar object being described.

elements.name: msItem
elements.desc: describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: msItemStruct
elements.content: ((locus|locusGrp)? (model_pLike+|(author* respStmt* title* rubric? incipit? msItemStruct* explicit? finalRubric? colophon* decoNote* listBibl* (bibl|biblStruct)* filiation? model_noteLike* textLang?)))
elements.desc: contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: msPart
elements.desc: contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, which is now part of a composite manuscript.

elements.name: namespace
elements.desc: supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.

elements.name: notatedMusic
elements.desc: encodes the presence of music notation in a text

elements.name: notesStmt
elements.desc: collects together any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description.

elements.name: normalization
elements.desc: indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.

elements.name: nym
elements.desc: contains the definition for a canonical name or name component of any kind.

elements.name: object
elements.desc: contains a description of a single identifiable physical object.

elements.name: objectDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the physical components making up the object which is being described.

elements.name: objectIdentifier
elements.desc: groups one or more identifiers or pieces of locating information concerning a single object.

elements.name: org
elements.desc: provides information about an identifiable organization such as a business, a tribe, or any other grouping of people.

elements.name: performance
elements.desc: contains a section of front or back matter describing how a dramatic piece is to be performed in general or how it was performed on some specific occasion.

elements.name: person
elements.desc: provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.

elements.name: persona
elements.desc: provides information about one of the personalities identified for a given individual, where an individual has multiple personalities.

elements.name: personGrp
elements.desc: describes a group of individuals treated as a single person for analytic purposes.

elements.name: place
elements.desc: contains data about a geographic location

elements.name: physDesc
elements.content: (model_pLike* (objectDesc? handDesc? typeDesc? scriptDesc? musicNotation? decoDesc? additions? bindingDesc? sealDesc? accMat?)?)
elements.desc: contains a full physical description of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object optionally subdivided using more specialized elements from the model.physDescPart class.

elements.name: particDesc
elements.desc: describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in any kind of text or other persons named or otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.

elements.name: population
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: contains information about the population of a place.

elements.name: postscript
elements.desc: contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.

elements.name: projectDesc
elements.desc: describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.

elements.name: prologue
elements.desc: contains the prologue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.

elements.name: prefixDef
elements.desc: defines a prefixing scheme used in teidata.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using the scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

elements.name: profileDesc
elements.desc: provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.

elements.name: publicationStmt
elements.desc: groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.

elements.name: punctuation
elements.desc: specifies editorial practice adopted with respect to punctuation marks in the original.

elements.name: quotation
elements.desc: specifies editorial practice adopted with respect to quotation marks in the original.

elements.name: rdgGrp
elements.desc: within a textual variation, groups two or more readings perceived to have a genetic relationship or other affinity.

elements.name: recordHist
elements.desc: provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript or object description itself.

elements.name: recording
elements.desc: provides details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast.

elements.name: recordingStmt
elements.desc: describes a set of recordings used as the basis for transcription of a spoken text.

elements.name: relatedItem
elements.desc: contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.

elements.name: relation
elements.desc: describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of places, events, persons, objects or other items.

elements.name: respStmt
elements.desc: supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work.

elements.name: revisionDesc
elements.desc: summarizes the revision history for a file.

elements.name: row
elements.desc: contains one row of a table.

elements.name: schemaRef
elements.desc: describes or points to a related customization or schema file

elements.name: scriptDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the scripts used in a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: scriptStmt
elements.desc: contains a citation giving details of the script used for a spoken text.

elements.name: seriesStmt
elements.desc: groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.

elements.name: seal
elements.desc: contains a description of one seal or similar applied to the object described

elements.name: sealDesc
elements.desc: describes the seals or similar items related to the object described, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of seal elements.

elements.name: segmentation
elements.desc: describes the principles according to which the text has been segmented, for example into sentences, tone-units, graphemic strata, etc.

elements.name: set
elements.desc: contains a description of the setting, time, locale, appearance, etc., of the action of a play, typically found in the front matter of a printed performance text (not a stage direction).

elements.name: setting
elements.desc: describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.

elements.name: settingDesc
elements.desc: describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, or other places otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.

elements.name: sourceDesc
elements.desc: describes the source(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated, typically a bibliographic description in the case of a digitized text, or a phrase such as "born digital" for a text which has no previous existence.

elements.name: sourceDoc
elements.desc: contains a transcription or other representation of a single source document potentially forming part of a dossier génétique or collection of sources.

elements.name: supportDesc
elements.desc: groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: sp
elements.desc: contains an individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.

elements.name: spanGrp
elements.desc: collects together span tags.

elements.name: samplingDecl
elements.desc: contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.

elements.name: spGrp
elements.desc: contains a group of speeches or songs in a performance text presented in a source as constituting a single unit or number.

elements.name: state
elements.group: model_personPart model_persStateLike model_orgStateLike model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: contains a description of some status or quality attributed to a person, place, or organization often at some specific time or for a specific date range.

elements.name: stdVals
elements.desc: specifies the format used when standardized date or number values are supplied.

elements.name: styleDefDecl
elements.desc: specifies the name of the formal language in which style or renditional information is supplied elsewhere in the document. The specific version of the scheme may also be supplied.

elements.name: surfaceGrp
elements.desc: defines any kind of useful grouping of written surfaces, for example the recto and verso of a single leaf, which the encoder wishes to treat as a single unit.

elements.name: surface
elements.desc: defines a written surface as a two-dimensional coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, zones of interest within that space, and transcriptions of the writing within them.

elements.name: refsDecl
elements.desc: specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text.

elements.name: tagsDecl
elements.desc: provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.

elements.name: taxonomy
elements.desc: defines a typology either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.

elements.name: table
elements.desc: contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns.

elements.name: terrain
elements.group: model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: contains information about the physical terrain of a place.

elements.name: textClass
elements.desc: groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.

elements.name: textDesc
elements.content: ((channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction preparedness) purpose+)
elements.desc: provides a description of a text in terms of its situational parameters.

elements.name: timeline
elements.desc: provides a set of ordered points in time which can be linked to elements of a spoken text to create a temporal alignment of that text.

elements.name: titlePage
elements.desc: contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter.

elements.name: titleStmt
elements.desc: groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its content.

elements.name: trait
elements.group: model_personPart model_persStateLike model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_placeStateLike
elements.desc: contains a description of some status or quality attributed to a person, place, or organization typically, but not necessarily, independent of the volition or action of the holder and usually not at some specific time or for a specific date range.

elements.name: transcriptionDesc
elements.desc: describes the set of transcription conventions used, particularly for spoken material.

elements.name: typeDesc
elements.desc: contains a description of the typefaces or other aspects of the printing of an incunable or other printed source.

elements.name: unitDecl
elements.desc: provides information about units of measurement that are not members of the International System of Units.

elements.name: unitDef
elements.desc: contains descriptive information related to a specific unit of measurement.

elements.name: vocal
elements.desc: marks any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.

elements.name: addSpan
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add).

elements.name: alt
elements.desc: identifies an alternation or a set of choices among elements or passages.

elements.name: anchor
elements.desc: attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element.

elements.name: cb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new column of a text on a multi-column page.

elements.name: caesura
elements.desc: marks the point at which a metrical line may be divided.

elements.name: catRef
elements.desc: specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.

elements.name: citeData
elements.desc: specifies how information may be extracted from citation structures.

elements.name: conversion
elements.desc: defines how to calculate one unit of measure in terms of another.

elements.name: damageSpan
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible.

elements.name: delSpan
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.

elements.name: gap
elements.desc: indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.

elements.name: gb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new gathering or quire in a transcribed codex.

elements.name: handShift
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint.

elements.name: lacunaEnd
elements.desc: indicates the end of a lacuna in a mostly complete textual witness.

elements.name: lacunaStart
elements.desc: indicates the beginning of a lacuna in the text of a mostly complete textual witness.

elements.name: lb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.

elements.name: link
elements.desc: defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.

elements.name: milestone
elements.desc: marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, typically but not necessarily indicating a point at which some part of a standard reference system changes, where the change is not represented by a structural element.

elements.name: move
elements.desc: marks the actual movement of one or more characters.

elements.name: pause
elements.desc: marks a pause either between or within utterances.

elements.name: pb
elements.desc: marks the beginning of a new page in a paginated document.

elements.name: ptr
elements.group: model_annotationPart_body_i model_phrase_i model_limitedPhrase_i model_correspContextPart_i model_publicationStmtPart_detail_i model_ptrLike_i
elements.desc: defines a pointer to another location.

elements.name: redo
elements.desc: indicates one or more cancelled interventions in a document which have subsequently been marked as reaffirmed or repeated.

elements.name: refState
elements.desc: specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the milestone method.

elements.name: shift
elements.desc: marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.

elements.name: undo
elements.desc: indicates one or more marked-up interventions in a document which have subsequently been marked for cancellation.

elements.name: when
elements.desc: indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely.

elements.name: witEnd
elements.desc: indicates the end, or suspension, of the text of a fragmentary witness.

elements.name: witStart
elements.desc: indicates the beginning, or resumption, of the text of a fragmentary witness.

elements.name: variantEncoding
elements.desc: declares the method used to encode text-critical variants.

elements.name: note
elements.group: model_global_i model_noteLike_i model_standOffPart_i model_annotationLike_i model_correspDescPart_i model_correspActionPart_i model_correspContextPart_i model_annotationPart_body_i
elements.desc: contains a note or annotation.

elements.name: certainty
elements.desc: indicates the degree of certainty associated with some aspect of the text markup.

elements.name: choice
elements.desc: groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.

elements.name: fw
elements.desc: contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.

elements.name: metamark
elements.desc: contains or describes any kind of graphic or written signal within a document the function of which is to determine how it should be read rather than forming part of the actual content of the document.

elements.name: precision
elements.desc: indicates the numerical accuracy or precision associated with some aspect of the text markup.

elements.name: respons
elements.desc: identifies the individual(s) responsible for some aspect of the content or markup of particular element(s).

elements.name: space

elements.name: additions

elements.name: authority
elements.desc: supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making a work available, other than a publisher or distributor.

elements.name: bibl

elements.desc: contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.
