elements.desc: defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.

elements.name: birth
elements.desc: contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place.

elements.name: byline
elements.desc: contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.

elements.name: camera
elements.desc: describes a particular camera angle or viewpoint in a screen play.

elements.name: caption
elements.desc: contains the text of a caption or other text displayed as part of a film script or screenplay.

elements.name: castItem
elements.desc: contains a single entry within a cast list, describing either a single role or a list of non-speaking roles.

elements.name: catDesc
elements.desc: describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.

elements.name: cell
elements.desc: contains one cell of a table.

elements.name: change
elements.desc: documents a change or set of changes made during the production of a source document, or during the revision of an electronic file.

elements.name: channel
elements.desc: describes the medium or channel by which a text is delivered or experienced. For a written text, this might be print, manuscript, email, etc.; for a spoken one, radio, telephone, face-to-face, etc.

elements.name: citedRange
elements.desc: defines the range of cited content, often represented by pages or other units

elements.name: classCode
elements.desc: contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.

elements.name: closer
elements.desc: groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.

elements.name: code
elements.desc: contains literal code from some formal language such as a programming language.

elements.name: collation
elements.desc: contains a description of how the leaves, bifolia, or similar objects are physically arranged.

elements.name: collection
elements.desc: contains the name of a collection of manuscripts or other objects, not necessarily located within a single repository.

elements.name: colophon
elements.desc: contains the colophon of an item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript or other object.

elements.name: condition
elements.desc: contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript or object.

elements.name: constitution
elements.desc: describes the internal composition of a text or text sample, for example as fragmentary, complete, etc.

elements.name: creation
elements.desc: contains information about the creation of a text.

elements.name: custEvent
elements.desc: describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: dateline
elements.desc: contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer.

elements.name: decoNote
elements.desc: contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript or other object, or a fairly homogenous class of such components.

elements.name: depth
elements.desc: contains a measurement from the front to the back of an object, perpendicular to the measurement given by the width element.

elements.name: death
elements.desc: contains information about a person's death, such as its date and place.

elements.name: derivation
elements.desc: describes the nature and extent of originality of this text.

elements.name: desc
elements.desc: contains a short description of the purpose, function, or use of its parent element, or when the parent is a documentation element, describes or defines the object being documented.

elements.name: dim
elements.desc: contains any single measurement forming part of a dimensional specification of some sort.

elements.name: distributor
elements.desc: supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text.

elements.name: docAuthor
elements.desc: contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).

elements.name: docDate
elements.desc: contains the date of a document, as given on a title page or in a dateline.

elements.name: docEdition
elements.desc: contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.

elements.name: docImprint
elements.desc: contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.

elements.name: domain
elements.desc: describes the most important social context in which the text was realized or for which it is intended, for example private vs. public, education, religion, etc.

elements.name: edition
elements.desc: describes the particularities of one edition of a text.

elements.name: editor
elements.desc: contains a secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.

elements.name: education
elements.desc: contains a description of the educational experience of a person.

elements.name: explicit
elements.desc: contains the explicit of a item, that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it.

elements.name: extent
elements.desc: describes the approximate size of a text stored on some carrier medium or of some other object, digital or non-digital, specified in any convenient units.

elements.name: factuality
elements.desc: describes the extent to which the text may be regarded as imaginative or non-imaginative, that is, as describing a fictional or a non-fictional world.

elements.name: faith
elements.desc: specifies the faith, religion, or belief set of a person.

elements.name: figDesc
elements.desc: contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it.

elements.name: filiation
elements.desc: contains information concerning the manuscript or other object's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts or other objects of the same text or contents, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs.

elements.name: finalRubric
elements.desc: contains the string of words that denotes the end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, usually set off from the text itself by red ink, by a different size or type of script, or by some other such visual device.

elements.name: floruit
elements.desc: contains information about a person's period of activity.

elements.name: foliation
elements.desc: describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex or similar object.

elements.name: formula
elements.desc: contains a mathematical or other formula.

elements.name: funder
elements.desc: specifies the name of an individual, institution, or organization responsible for the funding of a project or text.

elements.name: geo
elements.desc: contains any expression of a set of geographic coordinates, representing a point, line, or area on the surface of the earth in some notation.

elements.name: geoDecl
elements.desc: documents the notation and the datum used for geographic coordinates expressed as content of the geo element elsewhere within the document.

elements.name: handNote
elements.desc: describes a particular style or hand distinguished within a manuscript.

elements.name: head
elements.desc: contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.

elements.name: height
elements.desc: contains a measurement measured along the axis at a right angle to the bottom of the object.

elements.name: idno
elements.group: model_msItemPart model_addrPart model_phrase model_limitedPhrase model_pPart_data model_correspActionPart model_nameLike model_publicationStmtPart_detail model_personPart
elements.desc: supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way.

elements.name: imprimatur
elements.desc: contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.

elements.name: incipit
elements.desc: contains the incipit of a manuscript or similar object item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipits were, in former times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title.

elements.name: institution
elements.desc: contains the name of an organization such as a university or library, with which a manuscript or other object is identified, generally its holding institution.

elements.name: interaction
elements.desc: describes the extent, cardinality and nature of any interaction among those producing and experiencing the text, for example in the form of response or interjection, commentary, etc.

elements.name: interp
elements.desc: summarizes a specific interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text.

elements.name: item
elements.desc: contains one component of a list.

elements.name: l
elements.desc: contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.

elements.name: label
elements.desc: contains any label or heading used to identify part of a text, typically but not exclusively in a list or glossary.

elements.name: langKnown
elements.desc: summarizes the state of a person's linguistic competence, i.e., knowledge of a single language.

elements.name: language
elements.desc: characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.

elements.name: layout
elements.desc: describes how text is laid out on the page or surface of the object, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques.

elements.name: lem
elements.desc: contains the lemma, or base text, of a textual variation.

elements.name: licence
elements.desc: contains information about a licence or other legal agreement applicable to the text.

elements.name: line
elements.desc: contains the transcription of a topographic line in the source document

elements.name: locale
elements.desc: contains a brief informal description of the kind of place concerned, for example: a room, a restaurant, a park bench, etc.

elements.name: locus
elements.desc: defines a location within a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object typically as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references.

elements.name: measureGrp
elements.desc: contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.

elements.name: meeting
elements.group: model_divTop model_divBottom model_divWrapper model_biblPart model_msItemPart model_respLike
elements.desc: contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.

elements.name: metSym
elements.desc: documents the intended significance of a particular character or character sequence within a metrical notation, either explicitly or in terms of other metSym elements in the same metDecl.

elements.name: musicNotation
elements.desc: contains description of type of musical notation.

elements.name: msName
elements.desc: contains any form of unstructured alternative name used for a manuscript or other object, such as an ocellus nominum, or nickname.

elements.name: nationality
elements.desc: contains an informal description of a person's present or past nationality or citizenship.

elements.name: occupation
elements.desc: contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation.

elements.name: opener
elements.desc: groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.

elements.name: origin
elements.desc: contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object.

elements.name: p
elements.desc: marks paragraphs in prose.

elements.name: postBox
elements.desc: contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address.

elements.name: postCode
elements.desc: contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.

elements.name: preparedness
elements.desc: describes the extent to which a text may be regarded as prepared or spontaneous.

elements.name: principal
elements.desc: supplies the name of the principal researcher responsible for the creation of an electronic text.

elements.name: provenance
elements.desc: contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object after its creation but before its acquisition.

elements.name: publisher
elements.desc: provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

elements.name: pubPlace
elements.desc: contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.

elements.name: purpose
elements.desc: characterizes a single purpose or communicative function of the text.

elements.name: quote
elements.desc: contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.

elements.name: rendition
elements.desc: supplies information about the rendition or appearance of one or more elements in the source text.

elements.name: repository
elements.desc: contains the name of a repository within which manuscripts or other objects are stored, possibly forming part of an institution.

elements.name: residence
elements.desc: describes a person's present or past places of residence.

elements.name: resp
elements.desc: contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility, or an organization's role in the production or distribution of a work.

elements.name: rdg
elements.desc: contains a single reading within a textual variation.

elements.name: role
elements.desc: contains the name of a dramatic role, as given in a cast list.

elements.name: roleDesc
elements.desc: describes a character's role in a drama.

elements.name: rubric
elements.desc: contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words through which a manuscript or other object signals the beginning of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, typically in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.

elements.name: said
elements.desc: indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.

elements.name: salute
elements.desc: contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.

elements.name: scriptNote
elements.desc: describes a particular script distinguished within the description of a manuscript or similar resource.

elements.name: series
elements.desc: contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.

elements.name: sex
elements.desc: specifies the sex of a person.

elements.name: signed
elements.desc: contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text.

elements.name: socecStatus
elements.desc: contains an informal description of a person's perceived social or economic status.

elements.name: sound
elements.desc: describes a sound effect or musical sequence specified within a screen play or radio script.

elements.name: source
elements.desc: describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript or object description.

elements.name: speaker
elements.desc: contains a specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.

elements.name: sponsor
elements.desc: specifies the name of a sponsoring organization or institution.

elements.name: stage
elements.desc: contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.

elements.name: street
elements.desc: contains a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.

elements.name: summary
elements.desc: contains an overview of the available information concerning some aspect of an item or object (for example, its intellectual content, history, layout, typography etc.) as a complement or alternative to the more detailed information carried by more specific elements.

elements.name: support
elements.desc: contains a description of the materials etc. which make up the physical support for the written part of a manuscript or other object.

elements.name: surrogates
elements.desc: contains information about any representations of the manuscript or other object being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere.

elements.name: tagUsage
elements.desc: documents the usage of a specific element within a specified document.

elements.name: tech
elements.desc: describes a special-purpose stage direction that is not meant for the actors.

elements.name: textLang
elements.desc: describes the languages and writing systems identified within the bibliographic work being described, rather than its description.

elements.name: titlePart
elements.desc: contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.

elements.name: trailer
elements.desc: contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text.

elements.name: typeNote
elements.desc: describes a particular font or other significant typographic feature distinguished within the description of a printed resource.

elements.name: u
elements.desc: contains a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.

elements.name: view
elements.desc: describes the visual context of some part of a screen play in terms of what the spectator sees, generally independent of any dialogue.

elements.name: width
elements.desc: contains a measurement of an object along the axis parallel to its bottom, e.g. perpendicular to the spine of a book or codex.

elements.name: wit
elements.desc: contains a list of one or more sigla of witnesses attesting a given reading, in a textual variation.

elements.name: witDetail
elements.desc: gives further information about a particular witness, or witnesses, to a particular reading.

elements.name: witness
elements.desc: contains either a description of a single witness referred to within the critical apparatus, or a list of witnesses which is to be referred to by a single sigil.

elements.name: writing
elements.desc: contains a passage of written text revealed to participants in the course of a spoken text.

elements.name: zone
elements.desc: defines any two-dimensional area within a surface element.

rend.description: indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.

style.description: contains an expression in some formal style definition language which defines the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text

rendition.description: points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.

corresp.description: points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.

synch.description: points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.

sameAs.description: points to an element that is the same as the current element.

copyOf.description: points to an element of which the current element is a copy.

next.description: points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

prev.description: points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.

exclude.description: points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.

select.description: selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.

ana.description: indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.

facs.description: points to one or more images, portions of an image, or surfaces which correspond to the current element.

change.description: points to one or more change elements documenting a state or revision campaign to which the element bearing this attribute and its children have been assigned by the encoder.

cert.description: signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.

resp.description: indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.

source.description: specifies the source from which some aspect of this element is drawn.

xml:id.description: provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.

n.description: gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.

xml:lang.description: indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47.

xml:base.description: provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.

xml:space.description: signals an intention about how white space should be managed by applications.

valList.desc: signals that the application's default white-space processing modes are acceptable
indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space

type.description: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.

subtype.description: provides a sub-categorization of the element, if needed

type-app.description: classifies the variation contained in this element according to some convenient typology.

from.description: identifies the beginning of the lemma in the base text.

to.description: identifies the endpoint of the lemma in the base text.

loc.description: indicates the location of the variation, when the location-referenced method of apparatus markup is used.

targetLang.description: specifies the language of the content to be found at the destination referenced by target, using a language tag generated according to BCP 47.

target.description: specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References

evaluate.description: specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.

valList.desc: if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.

domains.description: optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.

targFunc.description: describes the function of each of the values of the target attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags.

mode.description: states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive.

valList.desc: indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs.
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur.

when.description: supplies the value of the date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notBefore.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

when-iso.description: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.

notBefore-iso.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

notAfter-iso.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

from-iso.description: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.

to-iso.description: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.

when-custom.description: supplies the value of a date or time in some custom standard form.

notBefore-custom.description: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

notAfter-custom.description: specifies the latest possible date for the event in some custom standard form.

from-custom.description: indicates the starting point of the period in some custom standard form.

to-custom.description: indicates the ending point of the period in some custom standard form.

datingPoint.description: supplies a pointer to some location defining a named point in time with reference to which the datable item is understood to have occurred

datingMethod.description: supplies a pointer to a calendar element or other means of interpreting the values of the custom dating attributes.

calendar.description: indicates one or more systems or calendars to which the date represented by the content of this element belongs.

period.description: supplies pointers to one or more definitions of named periods of time (typically categorys or calendars) within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

valList.desc: intent is to assess the target resource in some way, rather than simply make a comment about it
intent is to create a bookmark to the target or part thereof
intent is to classify the target in some way
intent is to comment about the target
intent is to describe the target, rather than (for example) comment on it
intent is to request an edit or a change to the target resource
intent is to highlight the target resource or a segment thereof
intent is to assign an identity to the target
intent is to link to a resource related to the target
intent is to assign some value or quality to the target
intent is to ask a question about the target
intent is to reply to a previous statement, either an annotation or another resource
intent is to associate a tag with the target

who.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.

dur.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

dur-iso.description: indicates the length of this element in time.

start.description: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element begins.

end.description: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element ends.

ident.description: supplies an identifier for the application, independent of its version number or display name.

version.description: supplies a version number for the application, independent of its identifier or display name.

default.description: indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.

valList.desc: This element is selected if its parent is selected
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.

status.description: supplies a code identifying the current availability of the text.

valList.desc: the text is freely available.
the status of the text is unknown.
the text is not freely available.

decls.description: identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.

sortKey.description: supplies the sort key for this element in an index, list or group which contains it.

contemporary.description: specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents

use.description: supplies an XPath selection pattern using the syntax defined in . The XPath pattern is relative to the context given in match, which will either be a sibling attribute in the case of citeStructure or on the parent citeStructure in the case of citeData.

delim.description: supplies a delimiting string preceding the structural component.

match.description: supplies an XPath selection pattern using the syntax defined in which identifies a set of nodes which are citable structural components. The expression may be absolute (beginning with /) or relative. match on a citeStructure without a citeStructure parent must be an absolute XPath. If it is relative, its context is set by the match of the parent citeStructure.

unit.description: describes the structural unit indicated by the citeStructure.

evidence.description: indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation.

valList.desc: there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.

instant.description: indicates whether this is an instant revision or not.

key.description: provides an externally-defined means of identifying the entity (or entities) being named, using a coded value of some kind.

ref.description: provides an explicit means of locating a full definition or identity for the entity being named by means of one or more URIs.

role.description: may be used to specify further information about the entity referenced by this name in the form of a set of whitespace-separated values, for example the occupation of a person, or the status of a place.

nymRef.description: provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object named by the element bearing it.

method.description: indicates the method adopted to indicate corrections within the text.

valList.desc: corrections have been made silently
corrections have been represented using markup

type-correspAction.description: describes the nature of the action.

valList.desc: information concerning the sending or dispatch of a message.
information concerning the receipt of a message.
information concerning the transmission of a message, i.e. between the dispatch and the next receipt, redirect or forwarding.
information concerning the redirection of an unread message.
information concerning the forwarding of a message.

matchPattern.description: specifies a regular expression against which the values of other attributes can be matched.

replacementPattern.description: specifies a replacement pattern, that is, the skeleton of a relative or absolute URI containing references to groups in the matchPattern which, once subpattern substitution has been performed, complete the URI.

atLeast.description: gives a minimum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

atMost.description: gives a maximum estimated value for the approximate measurement.

min.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the minimum value observed.

max.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation or a range, supplies the maximum value observed.

confidence.description: specifies the degree of statistical confidence (between zero and one) that a value falls within the range specified by min and max, or the proportion of observed values that fall within that range.

quantity.description: specifies the length in the units specified

extent.description: indicates the size of the object concerned using a project-specific vocabulary combining quantity and units in a single string of words.

precision.description: characterizes the precision of the values specified by the other attributes.

scope.description: where the measurement summarizes more than one observation, specifies the applicability of this measurement.

valList.desc: measurement applies to all instances.
measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.

type-dimensions.description: indicates which aspect of the object is being measured.

valList.desc: dimensions relate to one or more leaves (e.g. a single leaf, a gathering, or a separately bound part)
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been ruled in preparation for writing.
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been pricked out in preparation for ruling (used where this differs significantly from the ruled area, or where the ruling is not measurable).

dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been written, with the height measured from the top of the minims on the top line of writing, to the bottom of the minims on the bottom line of writing.
dimensions relate to the miniatures within the manuscript
dimensions relate to the binding in which the codex or manuscript is contained
dimensions relate to the box or other container in which the manuscript is stored.

met.description: contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional metrical structure of the element.

real.description: contains a user-specified encoding for the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure applicable to the element.

rhyme.description: specifies the rhyme scheme applicable to a group of verse lines.

part.description: specifies whether or not its parent element is fragmented in some way, typically by some other overlapping structure: for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas, a paragraph which is split across a page division, a verse line which is divided between two speakers.

valList.desc: the element is fragmented in some (unspecified) respect
the element is not fragmented, or no claim is made as to its completeness
this is the initial part of a fragmented element
this is a medial part of a fragmented element
this is the final part of a fragmented element

org.description: specifies how the content of the division is organized.

valList.desc: no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.
the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.

sample.description: indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.

valList.desc: division lacks material present at end in source.
division lacks material at start and end.
division lacks material at start.
position of sampled material within original unknown.
division is not a sample.

hand.description: points to a handNote element describing the hand considered responsible for the content of the element concerned.

type-divGen.description: specifies what type of generated text division (e.g. index, table of contents, etc.) is to appear.

valList.desc: an index is to be generated and inserted at this point.
a table of contents
a list of figures
a list of tables

where.description: indicates one or more locations by pointing to a place element or other canonical description.

place.description: specifies where this item is placed.

valList.desc: at the top of the page
at the foot of the page
in the margin (left, right, or both)
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
on the other side of the leaf
above the line
to the right, e.g. to the right of a vertical line of text, or to the right of a figure
below the line
to the left, e.g. to the left of a vertical line of text, or to the left of a figure
at the end of e.g. chapter or volume.
within the body of the text.
in a predefined space, for example left by an earlier scribe.

mimeType.description: specifies the applicable multimedia internet mail extension (MIME) media type

width.description: Where the media are displayed, indicates the display width

height.description: Where the media are displayed, indicates the display height

scale.description: Where the media are displayed, indicates a scale factor to be applied when generating the desired display size

url.description: specifies the URL from which the media concerned may be obtained.

hands.description: specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript

eol.description: indicates whether or not end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in a text.

valList.desc: all end-of-line hyphenation has been retained, even though the lineation of the original may not have been.
end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in some cases.
all soft end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining end-of-line hyphenation should be retained.
all end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining hyphenation occurred within the line.

inst.description: points to instances of the analysis or interpretation represented by the current element.

result.description: specifies the name of an element which this aggregation may be understood to represent.

scheme.description: identifies the controlled vocabulary within which the set of keywords concerned is defined, for example by a taxonomy element, or by some other resource.

toWhom.description: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom a speech act or action is directed.

iterated.description: indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.

tags.description: supplies one or more valid language tags for the languages specified

type-list.description: describes the nature of the items in the list.

valList.desc: each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.
each list item is an entry in an index such as the alphabetical topical index at the back of a print volume.
each list item is a step in a sequence of instructions, as in a recipe.
each list item is one of a sequence of petitions, supplications or invocations, typically in a religious ritual.
each list item is part of an argument consisting of two or more propositions and a final conclusion derived from them.

notation.description: names the notation used for the content of the element.

ordered.description: indicates whether the ordering of its child change elements is to be considered significant or not

pattern.description: specifies a regular expression defining any value that is legal for this notation.

defective.description: indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.

class.description: identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item by pointing to other elements or resources defining the classification concerned.

name.description: specifies the full formal name of the namespace concerned.

form.description: a short project-specific name identifying the physical form of the carrier, for example as a codex, roll, fragment, partial leaf, cutting etc.

sex.description: specifies the sex of the person.

age.description: specifies an age group for the person.

size.description: describes informally the size or approximate size of the group for example by means of a number and an indication of accuracy e.g. approx 200.

marks.description: indicates whether or not punctation marks have been retained as content within the text.

valList.desc: no punctuation marks have been retained
some punctuation marks have been retained
all punctuation marks have been retained

placement.description: indicates the positioning of punctuation marks that are associated with marked up text as being encoded within the element surrounding the text or immediately before or after it.

valList.desc: punctuation marks found at the start or end of a marked up text component are included within its surrounding element;
punctuation marks found at the start or end of a marked up text component appear immediately before or after the surrounding element

cause.description: classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.

varSeq.description: provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants.

require.description: points to other readings that are required when adopting the current reading or lemma.

valList.desc: audio recording
audio and video recording

active.description: identifies the active participants in a non-mutual relationship, or all the participants in a mutual one.

mutual.description: supplies a list of participants amongst all of whom the relationship holds equally.

passive.description: identifies the passive participants in a non-mutual relationship.

rows.description: indicates the number of rows occupied by this cell or row.

cols.description: indicates the number of columns occupied by this cell or row.

material.description: a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support

schemeVersion.description: supplies a version number for the style language provided in scheme.

ulx.description: gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.

uly.description: gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.

lrx.description: gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.

lry.description: gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.

points.description: identifies a two dimensional area by means of a series of pairs of numbers, each of which gives the x,y coordinates of a point on a line enclosing the area.

attachment.description: describes the method by which this surface is or was connected to the main surface

valList.desc: glued in place
pinned or stapled in place
sewn in place

flipping.description: indicates whether the surface is attached and folded in such a way as to provide two writing surfaces

partial.description: indicates whether the element types listed exhaustively include all those found within text, or represent only a subset.

origin.description: designates the origin of the timeline, i.e. the time at which it begins.

interval.description: specifies a time interval either as a positive integral value or using one of a set of predefined codes.

type-titlePage.description: classifies the title page according to any convenient typology.

seq.description: assigns a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

spanTo.description: indicates the end of a span initiated by the element bearing this attribute.

weights.description: If mode is excl, each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs. If mode is incl each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs given that at least one of the other alternatives occurs.

ed.description: supplies a sigil or other arbitrary identifier for the source edition in which the associated feature (for example, a page, column, or line break) occurs at this point in the text.

edRef.description: provides a pointer to the source edition in which the associated feature (for example, a page, column, or line break) occurs at this point in the text.

break.description: indicates whether or not the element bearing this attribute should be considered to mark the end of an orthographic token in the same way as whitespace.

valList.desc: the element bearing this attribute is considered to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence of any adjacent whitespace
the element bearing this attribute is considered not to mark the end of any adjacent orthographic token irrespective of the presence of any adjacent whitespace
the encoding does not take any position on this issue.

property.description: A URI indicating a property definition.

formula.description: A formula is provided to describe a mathematical calculation such as a conversion between measurement systems.

fromUnit.description: indicates a source unit of measure that is to be converted into another unit indicated in toUnit.

toUnit.description: the target unit of measurement for a conversion from a source unit referenced in fromUnit.

agent.description: categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

valList.desc: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface
damage results from smoke

degree.description: provides a coded representation of the degree of damage, either as a number between 0 (undamaged) and 1 (very extensively damaged), or as one of the codes high, medium, low, or unknown. The damage element with the degree attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; text supplied from other sources should be tagged as supplied.

group.description: assigns an arbitrary number to each stretch of damage regarded as forming part of the same physical phenomenon.

valList.desc: for features omitted from transcription due to editorial policy

scribe.description: gives a name or other identifier for the scribe believed to be responsible for this hand.

scribeRef.description: points to a full description of the scribe concerned, typically supplied by a person element elsewhere in the description.

script.description: characterizes the particular script or writing style used by this hand, for example secretary, copperplate, Chancery, Italian, etc.

scriptRef.description: points to a full description of the script or writing style used by this hand, typically supplied by a scriptNote element elsewhere in the description.

medium.description: describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil

new.description: indicates a handNote element describing the hand concerned.

wit.description: contains a space-delimited list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses to this reading beginning or ending at this point.

type-move.description: characterizes the movement, for example as an entrance or exit.

valList.desc: character is entering the stage.
character is exiting the stage.
character moves on stage

perf.description: identifies the performance or performances in which this movement occurred as specified by pointing to one or more performance elements.

cRef.description: specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference expressed using the scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

length.description: specifies the fixed length of the reference component.

valList.desc: speed of utterance.
loudness.
pitch range.
tension or stress pattern.
rhythmic qualities.
voice quality.

absolute.description: supplies an absolute value for the time.

since.description: identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point.

location.description: indicates whether the apparatus appears within the running text or external to it.

valList.desc: apparatus appears within the running text.
apparatus appears outside the base text.

anchored.description: indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.

targetEnd.description: points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.

type-certainty.description: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology; sample categorization of annotations of uncertainty might use following values:

cert-certainty.description: signifies the degree of certainty associated with the object pointed to by the certainty element.

locus.description: indicates more exactly the aspect concerning which certainty is being expressed: specifically, whether the markup is correctly located, whether the correct element or attribute name has been used, or whether the content of the element or attribute is correct, etc.

valList.desc: uncertainty concerns whether the name of the element or attribute used is correctly applied.
uncertainty concerns whether the start of the element is correctly identified.
uncertainty concerns whether the end of the element is correctly identified.
uncertainty concerns both the start and the end of the element.
uncertainty concerns the content (for an element) or the value (for an attribute)

assertedValue.description: provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question—an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text.

given.description: indicates one or more element(s) characterizing the conditions which are assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence.

type-fw.description: classifies the material encoded according to some useful typology.

valList.desc: a running title at the top of the page
a running title at the bottom of the page
a page number or foliation symbol
a line number, either of prose or poetry
a signature or gathering symbol
a catch-word

function.description: describes the function (for example status, insertion, deletion, transposition) of the metamark.

stdDeviation.description: supplies a standard deviation associated with the value in question

dim.description: indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical.

valList.desc: the space is horizontal.
the space is vertical.

resp-space.description: (responsible party) indicates the individual responsible for identifying and measuring the space

full.description: indicates whether the name component is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial.

valList.desc: the name component is spelled out in full.
the name component is given in an abbreviated form.
the name component is indicated only by one initial.

sort.description: specifies the sort order of the name component in relation to others within the name.

value.description: supplies a regularized value for personal pronouns.

valList.desc: e/eirs
he/him/his
she/her/hers
they/them/theirs

label.description: provides a label (usually a single letter) to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string instantiates.

datcat.description: contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the given element with the appropriate Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

valueDatcat.description: contains a PID (persistent identifier) that aligns the content of the given element or the value of the given attribute with the appropriate simple Data Category (or categories) in ISOcat.

level.description: indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.

valList.desc: the title applies to an analytic item, such as an article, poem, or other work published as part of a larger item.
the title applies to a monograph such as a book or other item considered to be a distinct publication, including single volumes of multi-volume works
the title applies to any serial or periodical publication such as a journal, magazine, or newspaper
the title applies to a series of otherwise distinct publications such as a collection
the title applies to any unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)

type-title.description: classifies the title according to some convenient typology.

valList.desc: main title
subtitle, title of part
alternate title, often in another language, by which the work is also known
abbreviated form of title
descriptive paraphrase of the work functioning as a title

unitRef.description: points to a unique identifier stored in the xml:id of a unitDef element that defines a unit of measure.

commodity.description: indicates the substance that is being measured

type-abbr.description: allows the encoder to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology.

valList.desc: the abbreviation provides the first letter(s) of the word or phrase, omitting the remainder.
the abbreviation omits some letter(s) in the middle.
the abbreviation comprises a special symbol or mark.
the abbreviation includes writing above the line.
the abbreviation comprises the initial letters of the words of a phrase.
the abbreviation is for a title of address (Dr, Ms, Mr, …)
the abbreviation is for the name of an organization.
the abbreviation is for a geographic name.

type-distinct.description: specifies the sublanguage or register to which the word or phrase is being assigned

time.description: specifies how the phrase is distinct diachronically

space.description: specifies how the phrase is distinct diatopically

social.description: specifies how the phrase is distinct diastratically

versionDate.description: specifies the date on which the source text was extracted and sent to the translator

type-measure.description: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

type-num.description: indicates the type of numeric value.

valList.desc: absolute number, e.g. 21, 21.5
ordinal number, e.g. 21st
fraction, e.g. one half or three-quarters
a percentage
age of a fictional character at the time the story takes place, rather than at the time the story is told
the item describes a single role.
the item describes a list of non-speaking roles.

lang.description: a name identifying the formal language in which the code is expressed

type-constitution.description: specifies how the text was constituted.

valList.desc: a single complete text
a text made by combining several smaller items, each individually complete
a text made by combining several smaller, not necessarily complete, items
composition unknown or unspecified

type-derivation.description: categorizes the derivation of the text.

valList.desc: text is original
text is a revision of some other text
text is a translation of some other text
text is an abridged version of some other text
text is plagiarized from some other text
text has no obvious source but is one of a number derived from some common ancestor
This element describes why or how its parent element is being deprecated, typically including recommendations for alternate encoding.
art and entertainment
domestic and private
religious and ceremonial
business and work place
education
government and law
other forms of public context

type-factuality.description: categorizes the factuality of the text.

valList.desc: the text is to be regarded as entirely imaginative
the text is to be regarded as entirely informative or factual
the text contains a mixture of fact and fiction
the fiction/fact distinction is not regarded as helpful or appropriate to this text

datum.description: supplies a commonly used code name for the datum employed.

valList.desc: a pair of numbers to be interpreted as latitude followed by longitude according to the World Geodetic System.
the values supplied are geospatial entity object codes, based on
the value supplied is to be interpreted as a British National Grid Reference.
the value supplied is to be interpreted as latitude followed by longitude according to the European Datum coordinate system.

type-idno.description: categorizes the identifier, for example as an ISBN, Social Security number, etc.

valList.desc: International Standard Book Number: a 13- or (if assigned prior to 2007) 10-digit identifying number assigned by the publishing industry to a published book or similar item, registered with the International ISBN Agency.
International Standard Serial Number: an eight-digit number to uniquely identify a serial publication.
Digital Object Identifier: a unique string of letters and numbers assigned to an electronic document.
Uniform Resource Identifier: a string of characters to uniquely identify a resource which usually contains indication of the means of accessing that resource, the name of its host, and its filepath.
A data number in the Virtual Internet Authority File assigned to link different names in catalogs around the world for the same entity.
English Short-Title Catalogue number: an identifying number assigned to a document in English printed in the British Isles or North America before 1801.
OCLC control number (record number) for the union catalog record in WorldCat, a union catalog for member libraries in the Online Computer Library Center global cooperative.

type-interaction.description: specifies the degree of interaction between active and passive participants in the text.

valList.desc: no interaction of any kind, e.g. a monologue
some degree of interaction, e.g. a monologue with set responses
complete interaction, e.g. a face to face conversation
this parameter is inappropriate or inapplicable in this case

enjamb.description: indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.

valList.desc: the line is end-stopped
the line in question runs on into the next
the line is weakly enjambed
the line is strongly enjambed

tag.description: supplies a valid language tag for the language concerned.

usage.description: specifies the approximate percentage (by volume) of the text which uses this language.

columns.description: specifies the number of columns per page

streams.description: indicates the number of streams per page, each of which contains an independent textual stream

ruledLines.description: specifies the number of ruled lines per column

writtenLines.description: specifies the number of written lines per column

terminal.description: specifies whether the symbol is defined in terms of other symbols (terminal is set to false) or in prose (terminal is set to true).

code.description: identifies an occupation code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the scheme attribute.

type-preparedness.description: a keyword characterizing the type of preparedness.

valList.desc: spontaneous or unprepared
follows a script
follows a predefined set of conventions
polished or revised before presentation

type-purpose.description: specifies a particular kind of purpose.

valList.desc: didactic, advertising, propaganda, etc.
self expression, confessional, etc.
convey information, educate, etc.
amuse, entertain, etc.

selector.description: contains a selector or series of selectors specifying the elements to which the contained style description applies, expressed in the language specified in the scheme attribute.

aloud.description: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.

direct.description: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

type-sound.description: categorizes the sound in some respect, e.g. as music, special effect, etc.

discrete.description: indicates whether the sound overlaps the surrounding speeches or interrupts them.

gi.description: specifies the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag, within the namespace indicated by the parent namespace element.

occurs.description: specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text.

withId.description: specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text which bear a distinct value for the global xml:id attribute.

valList.desc: a lighting cue
a sound cue
a prop cue
a blocking instruction

mainLang.description: supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the bibliographic work.

otherLangs.description: one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the bibliographic work.

type-titlePart.description: specifies the role of this subdivision of the title.

valList.desc: main title of the work
subtitle of the work
alternative title of the work
abbreviated form of title
descriptive paraphrase of the work

trans.description: indicates the nature of the transition between this utterance and the previous one.

valList.desc: this utterance begins without unusual pause or rapidity.
this utterance begins with a markedly shorter pause than normal.
this utterance begins before the previous one has finished.
this utterance begins after a noticeable pause.

type-witDetail.description: describes the type of information given about the witness.

gradual.description: indicates whether the writing is revealed all at once or gradually.

rotate.description: indicates the amount by which this zone has been rotated clockwise, with respect to the normal orientation of the parent surface element as implied by the dimensions given in the msDesc element or by the coordinates of the surface itself. The orientation is expressed in arc degrees.
